name: Starvation Creek
description:
Introduction

Starvation Creek is park of Starvation Creek St Forest. It is very popular with passerby’s so only attempt if you are confident in your skills so your visibility to hikers are as little as possible.

  • Watershed: 1.05mi^2.

Approach

Use the Starvation Ridge Trail until you get to 1250” elevation, just as you start on the bottom of Starvation Ridge. Scramble down about 600 feet down where you will reach the creek.

Descent

R1 - Tree DCL 40 feet

R2 - Tree DCL 170 feet

R3 - Bolt station DCR 60 feet

May be prudent to bring a drill to put a bolt in between R2-R3 to make the pull easier and getting to R3 easier.

Exit

Walk 200 feet to the parking area.

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

  • Waterfalls NorthWest

Background

First know descent by Haruka James Clay Lipscomb, Michael Peterson, and Ryan Ernst.
